text: Origes is a genus of South American huntsman spiders that was first described by Eugène Louis Simon in 1897. it contains three species, found in Ecuador, Peru, and Argentina: O. chloroticus, O. nigrovittatus, and O. pollens. O. chloroticus may be misplaced in this genus and family. ==See also== * List of Sparassidae species ==References== Category:Araneomorphae genera Category:Sparassidae Category:Spiders of South America
title: Origes
